meanings.definition: Feeling or expressing overwhelming happiness or joyful excitement.
meanings.sent1: The children were ecstatic when they found out school was canceled due to snow.
meanings.sent2: She was ecstatic to receive a surprise gift from her best friend.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked ecstatic as it chased its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: His face lit up with an ecstatic smile when he saw his favorite band perform live.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's eyes sparkled with an ecstatic joy as she opened her birthday presents.

meanings.definition: In a state of extreme happiness or delight.
meanings.sent1: The team was ecstatic after winning the championship game.
meanings.sent2: He felt ecstatic when he saw his long-lost friend at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked ecstatic as it basked in the warm sunlight streaming through the window.
meanings.sent4: The garden was an ecstatic riot of colors in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The crowd erupted into ecstatic cheers as the fireworks lit up the night sky.
